entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 4:30AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Along The Tanana River Into Next Week... High water continues along glacially fed rivers draining the Alaska Range, including the Delta, Nenana and Tanana Rivers. Warm temperatures continue to cause enhanced glacial and high elevation snowmelt runoff. Heavy rainfall several days ago in the Alaska Range is also contributing additional water to the Delta,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 10:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Thunderstorms Tonight... Isolated strong thunderstorms are occuring and will continue into into early Friday morning. Frequent lightning, brief heavy rain, winds gusting to 30 mph and hail will occur. Some of the hail could be over 1 inch in diameter. People in the Eagle and Twelve Mile Summit area as well as the Brooks Range should move to lower
entry.cap:areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands
